question: On December 21, 1896, at home, what did Steven know Robert (the mother) would exclaim upon suddenly seeing the lipstick on her niece's lips?
On December 22, 1896, what did the committee members say in surprise regarding the news about De Paul and Steven?

On December 24, 1896, which name did Arthur insert into the listings for the performances meant to pass the evening?
According to Paul on December 25, 1896, what was the subject of the booklet written by his friend's son regarding the Bulgarian army?
In the study on December 25, 1896, which specific securities did Paul recommend James purchase?

What cold dish appeared under the 'Michelangelo' design of the kitchen during the dinner on December 25, 1896?
Which Arabic proverb did Paul quote during the dinner conversation on December 26, 1896?

On December 30, 1896, whose photos did Françoise pick out as New Year's gifts at the open-air stall?

What motto was inscribed on the silver seal of the letter Steven received on January 26, 1897?
On February 3, 1897, what object was printed at the top of the letter with Michael's name in gold?
What did the sign at the entrance of the Matthew staircase read on February 4, 1897?

Until what specific time did Steven stroll up and down the street near Matthew's house on February 24, 1897?

What kind of hat was the lady (Princess Mathilde) wearing when Steven saw her near the Zoo on March 8, 1897?

On April 25, 1897, how much money did the antique shopkeeper offer Steven for the Chinese porcelain vase?
What liquid were the Stevenes sprinkling onto two flatfish during lunch at the Balbec Hotel Restaurant on May 4, 1897?
On the morning of May 4, 1897, at the Balbec Hotel Restaurant, what object did the sunlight burning the sea resemble?

Who did the Frenchman claiming to be the king of a small island in Oceania live with in a guesthouse at the Balbec Hotel on May 4, 1897?
What flower did the young man called "the Handsome Fellow" wear in his buttonhole at the Balbec Hotel on the afternoon of May 4, 1897?
Which two individuals from an ancient Breton family did Steven encounter in the dining room of the Balbec Hotel on May 4, 1897?
When the general manager appeared at the restaurant entrance of the big hotel on the evening of May 5, 1897, what color was his hair?
Who did Françoise get to know at the hotel besides the head waiter in charge of beverages, according to the records from May 5, 1897?
Why did the Stevenes no longer have hot water at the Hotel on the morning of May 5, 1897?
In the Barber Shop scene described on May 10, 1897, who did the barber recognize that made him strike up a conversation?
On May 11, 1897, whenever Steven's grandmother noticed Charles looking at a book or receiving fruit, what would happen an hour later?
On May 15, 1897, David suggested that Steven ask Charles if she was related to which family?
Among the fruits seen in front of the hotel on May 17, 1897, what were the pears compared to in terms of color?
What object was Madame de Luxembourg leaning on when Steven saw her on the seawall on May 21, 1897?
What specific item did the princess's wife buy from the street vendor for Steven's grandmother on the Seawall on May 21, 1897?
Who did the princess tell to pay the merchant on the Harbor Wall on May 21, 1897?

According to the gossip heard at the Hotel on May 23, 1897, what color was the hair of the woman who visited Charles?
According to background information provided on May 24, 1897, who was Sophia the niece of?
What kind of flowers were embroidered on the sofa in Grandmother's room on May 24, 1897?
Where did Madame Bontemps claim the Marceaux went on Sunday, May 25, 1897, when speaking at the hotel entrance?
What specific parts of the apple tree were remaining when Steven saw it on the country path on May 25, 1897?
According to the dialogue in the carriage on May 27, 1897, what list of qualities were writers like Chateaubriand and Balzac said to be lacking?
What was in the small basin in front of the tall girl sitting on the edge of the bridge in Clarkville on June 3, 1897?
Where did Steven tell the girl fishing he needed to go, according to the dialogue on the Clarkville Bridge on June 3, 1897?

On August 13, 1897, at the studio of Elstir, what is the full name of the girl Elstir identifies as pushing a bicycle?
On August 13, 1897, what specific beauty mark does Steven notice on Albertine while she offers her hand to the painter at the studio window?
In Elstir's studio on August 13, 1897, what is the title and specific month and year written beneath the watercolor portrait of the young woman in the soft cap?
On August 14, 1897, while on the seawall, Elstir mentions a landscape in France that reminds him of Florida. What is the name of this location?
On August 15, 1897, at Elstir's doorstep, what specific item does Elstir give Steven as a gift in memory of their friendship?
According to the letter Steven received on August 20, 1897, what is the name of the author of the book Peter bought at the station?
On August 27, 1897, in the Balbec Restaurant, what specific detail is noted at the bottom of the oyster shells on the tablecloth?
On August 31, 1897, while standing beside Albertine at Elstir's house, where does Steven notice a small beauty mark?

On September 13, 1897, on the seawall, what is the name of the discontinued object Albertine is holding on a silk rope?
On September 18, 1897, Elstir mentions four specific 'fashion masters' to Albertine and Steven. Who are they?
On September 19, 1897, Elstir shows a sketch of powerful rock formations that resemble a great cathedral. What is the name of the location where this sketch was taken?
What is the name of the specific farmhouse restaurant where the group of girls usually goes for tea, as mentioned on September 21, 1897?
On September 22, 1897, on the cliff, what three-word message does Albertine write on a note and hand to Steven?
On October 13, 1897, what specific item does Albertine give to Steven because she regrets not making him happy?
On October 16, 1897, at the Grand Hotel de Balbec, the narrator notes the manager's face seems to be a mixture of makeup and flesh. What is the ratio described?
On November 4, 1897, at the new residence, what three specific emotions does Steven observe in Mark's eyes?
On November 26, 1897, in the kitchen, Françoise mentions a 'saint' she worked for at Sunrise. What was the name of this woman?
On January 12, 1898, what specific medical reason is given for M. Samuel and his family not returning to Fairhaven this year?
On January 23, 1898, David gives Steven an opera ticket to see the actress Arthur perform a scene from which specific play?
On January 24, 1898, at the Opera House, what does Madame de Bouville offer to do for Omar Samuel in the darkness of the box?
On January 27, 1898, what specific floral accessory on the Princess de Fairhaven's head is described as resembling a kingfisher's nest?
On February 7, 1898, what specific type of flowers are in the blue earthenware vase in the corridor of the Hôtel de Flandres?
On February 8, 1898, what specific time is it when the housewife informs Steven that it is time to wake up, only to find him already awake?
On February 8, 1898, in the Hall of Thought, what term do the Stevenes use to describe the deep sleep that makes the body feel heavy and lifeless like lead?
On the morning of February 8, 1898, what three physical details are used to describe Steven's deceased parents in his nightmare while they are confined in a mouse cage?
On February 14, 1898, in Marcel's room, what specific color and pattern of paper is described as being pasted in Steven's bathroom?
On the morning of March 10, 1898, at the campsite, what color undershirt was Peter's colleague reportedly wearing at the Café de la Paix, and how was it decorated?
On March 16, 1898, in Marcel's Room, what specific item is described as hanging on the wall in the back room of the suite?
On March 17, 1898, while exploring the corridor of the Hotel de Flandres, what specific flowers are mentioned as being in the blue clay vase on the shelf?
On the evening of April 1, 1898, at the Place d'Eastchiel, what were the two distinct visual appearances of the two fountains described by the narrator?
On the afternoon of April 4, 1898, in the grand dining room of the hotel, what new heavenly figure was added alongside the existing statue?
On May 25, 1898, in the hotel at East Sillé, what specific artistic subjects did the painter George (Elstir) start his career with before moving to landscapes?
On May 26, 1898, at the hotel in East Sillé, for how many years had the prince (Unknown_Borodino) accumulated unpaid debts at the local barber's?
On the evening of May 29, 1898, in the Hotel de Flandres, what specific type and color of tableware did Unknown_Borodino set out for his dinner guests?

In the early morning of May 31, 1898, at the post office, what mythological group did the narrator compare the invisible telephone operators to while they were 'emptying and filling the box of sound'?
On the evening of June 4, 1898, when returning to the living room in Paris, what physical feature of his grandmother's face did the narrator compare to an Egyptian pyramid?
On the morning of July 13, 1898, on a street in Paris, what specific outfit was Edward (Duchesse de Guermantes) wearing when she met Steven during Lent?
On the afternoon of July 15, 1898, during his nap in Paris, what specific allegorical painting and goddess did Steven's image in his dream resemble?
On October 5, 1898, in a suburban village, how much did the necklace Peter intended to buy for his mistress at Bousseron (Boucheron) cost?
On the morning of October 6, 1898, at the hotel, which specific member of the French Academy did the foreman standing at the table resemble?
On the evening of October 6, 1898, in the private room of the hotel, how many identical rooms were reflected in the perspective of the strange mirror when the light was on?
On the night of October 6, 1898, at the theater, what two physical characteristics of the debutante actress formed a laughing contrast for the narrator?
On the afternoon of October 7, 1898, in the Villeparisis drawing room, Madame de Villeparisis identified the portrait of Marie de Rohan as being which other historical personage?
On October 13, 1898, in the drawing room of Villeparisis, what specific letters and crest were inside the hat that Steven mistakenly held?
On the afternoon of October 15, 1898, what was the specific temperature reading on the grandmother's thermometer that the narrator refers to as the 'fateful symbol'?
On October 15, 1898, at home, what was the specific daily diet Professor Godard (Cottard) prescribed to relieve the grandmother's restlessness?
On the afternoon of October 16, 1898, at the Champs-Élysées restroom, what was the lady attendant ('Charles') wearing on her head, including the specific flower color?
